title: Attributed Description Logics: Ontologies for Knowledge Graphs

author: Ana Ozaki, Dresden University of Technology

segmentation: I'm going to present our work on attribute in description logics.
Knowledge graphs are used in many data intensive applications in companies such as Google and Facebook.

The image that you see here is from the web page of Google's Knowledge Graph, and there's actually no standard definition of what is knowledge graph, But the main idea is that we have a label at graph where we can enrich edges and nodes with annotation so and they often come in the format of attribute value pairs.
So this annotation stay provides context contextual information such as temporal validity language provenance.

They can also be used to encode NR relations and many others, and the shift towards this knowledge graphs is motivated by the need of integrating knowledge coming from various sources into a common format.
And example we have here is from the from wiki data.
About the City of Vienna, we have the information that the head of the government here and we also have some extra information which are like annotations, start time and reference.
So some information about the provenance.

They are kind of natural formulas to express schema information over knowledge graphs, but what we observe is that there is a kind of.
